content: northern lace by elizabeth lovick everyday beanie for all the family in jamieson and smith s chunky shetland wool so simple even your man will wear it materials 1 x 100g ball jamieson and smith s chunky pair 5 mm and 6 mm us 8 and 10 needles tapestry needle for sewing up sizes to fit toddler child teen adult the hat is very stretchy gauge 16 sts and 24 row to 4 ins over pattern on 6 mm needles abbreviations sts - stitches k - knit p - purl k2tog - knit next two stitches together p2tog - purl next two stitches together m1 - make 1 by picking up the strand before the next stitch and knitting into the back of it k1 p1 rib - every row *k1 p1 repeat to end of row notes if there is only one figure it applies to all sizes © elizabeth lovick 2010 www northernlace co uk 1 main part with 5 mm needles cast on 56 64 72 80 sts work in k1 p1 rib for 3 3 5 5 row next row rib to last st m1 p1 57 65 73 81 sts change to 6 mm needles and pattern as follows row 1 *k2 p2 repeat from * to last st k1 this one row forms the pattern repeat it until the work measures 5 5 5 6 7 ins from the cast on edge shape top row 1 *k2 p2 k2 p2tog repeat from * to last st k1 row 2 k1 *p2 k2 p2 k1 repeat from * to end of row row 3 *k2 p2 k1 k2tog repeat from * to last st k1 row 4 k1 *p1 k2 p2 k1 repeat from * to end of row row 5 *k2 p2 k2tog repeat from * to last st k1 row 6 k1 *k2 p2 k1 repeat from * to end of row row 7 *k2 p1 p2tog repeat from * to last st k1 row 8 k1 *k2tog p1 k1 repeat from * to end of row row 9 *k1 k2tog repeat from * to last st k1 row 10 p1 *p2tog repeat from * to end of row row 11 *k2tog repeat from * to last st k1 break yarn leaving a long tail for sewing up draw through remaining sts finishing sew up back seam if required sew patch or flowers on the front or over the ear chart for crown shaping © elizabeth lovick 2010 www northernlace co uk 2
